Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure :
CABGx4 ( 06-26 )
History of Present Illness :
69yoM with OA having workup for knee replacements found to be in Afib , had stress test that was positive followed by cardiac catheterization which revealed severe 3VD .
Then referred for CABG
Past Medical History :

chol
AFib

CRI

Remote Timothy , quit 1990 . + ETOH ( 1-2 drinks / Rivero )

Admission

Ext warm 2+ edema

2019-06-30 11:26 AM
CHEST ( PORTABLE AP )
Reason : Effusion ? Pntx ?
UNDERLYING MEDICAL CONDITION :
69 year old man with s/p Off Pump CABG
REASON FOR THIS EXAMINATION :
Effusion ? Pntx ?
PORTABLE CHEST ON 2019-06-30 AT 11:39
INDICATION : CABG with chest tube in place .
COMPARISON : 2019-06-29 .
FINDINGS : Left chest tube remains in place with some density adjacent to the tip , but there is no significant interval change vs . prior .
Specifically , there is no pneumothorax and no interval development of effusion .
Cardiac silhouette and mediastinal contours are stable .
IMPRESSION : No change vs . prior .
DR. James A Roberts
Brief Hospital Course :
69 yo M with known Atrial fibrillation and coronary artery disease admitted preop for transition fro Coumadin to Heparin .
Brought to the OR on 06-26 for CABG , please see OR report for details .
In summary pt had off pump CABGx4 with LIMA-LAD , SVG OM-Y graft - Diag , SVG-PDA .
Pt tolerated surgery well and was transferred to CT CMED ICU .
He did well in immediate post-op period was extubated and on POD1 he was transferred to the step down floor .
On POD2 his chest tubes and epicardial pacing wires were removed and his Coumadin was restarted .
Over the next several days his activity was advanced on POD5 it was decided he was stable and ready to be discharged home with visiting nurses .
Medications on Admission :
Atenolol 200 '
HCTZ 25 '
Lisinopril 20 '
Ultram 50 '
Prilosec 20 '
Zocor 40 '
Levitra / prn
Warfarin 4 '
Discharge Medications :
1. Metoprolol Tartrate 25 mg Tablet Sig : One ( 1 ) Tablet PO BID ( 2 times a Ellis ).
Disp :* 60 Tablet (s)* Refills :* 2 *
2. Furosemide 20 mg Tablet Sig : One ( 1 ) Tablet PO once a Leukhardt for 2 weeks .
Disp :* 14 Tablet (s)* Refills :* 0 *
3. Potassium Chloride 10 mEq Tablet Sustained Release Sig : Two ( 2 ) Tablet Sustained Release PO once a Sine for 2 weeks .
Disp :* 28 Tablet Sustained Release (s)* Refills :* 0 *
4. Docusate Sodium 100 mg Capsule Sig : One ( 1 ) Capsule PO BID ( 2 times a Costa ).
Disp :* 60 Capsule (s)* Refills :* 2 *
5. Aspirin 81 mg Tablet , Delayed Release ( E.C. ) Sig : One ( 1 ) Tablet , Delayed Release ( E.C. ) PO DAILY ( Daily ).
Disp :* 30 Tablet , Delayed Release ( E.C. )(s)* Refills :* 2 *
6. Warfarin 2 mg Tablet Sig : Two ( 2 ) Tablet PO once a Avrett : target INR 1.5-2 .
Disp :* 60 Tablet (s)* Refills :* 2 *
7. Oxycodone - Acetaminophen 5-325 mg Tablet Sig : 1-2 Tablets PO every 4-6 hours as needed for pain .
Disp :* 50 Tablet (s)* Refills :* 0 *
8. Simvastatin 40 mg Tablet Sig : One ( 1 ) Tablet PO DAILY ( Daily ).
Disp :* 30 Tablet (s)* Refills :* 2 *
9. Prilosec 20 mg Capsule , Delayed Release ( E.C. ) Sig : One ( 1 ) Capsule , Delayed Release ( E.C. ) PO once a Gray .
10. Ultram 50 mg Tablet Sig : One ( 1 ) Tablet PO Q6 hrs / PRN .
Discharge Disposition :
Home with Service
Discharge Diagnosis :
s/p off pump CABGx4 LIMA-LAD ,Y SVG-OM-Diag, SVG-PDA ( 06-26 ) PMH : HTN , chol , AF , OA , CRI , s/p bilat knee surgery
Discharge Condition :
good
Discharge Instructions :
Keep wounds clean and dry .
OK to shower , no bathing or swimming .
Take all medications as prescribed
Call for any fever , redness or drainage from wounds .
Followup Instructions :
Wound clinic in 2 weeks
Dr Anderson in 2-3 weeks
Dr Brown in 4 weeks
Ada Jordan MD 62-102
Completed by : MARK Eugene NP 80-AUO 2019-07-01 @ 1417
Signed electronically by : DR. Elizabeth P. Fernandez on : TUE 2019-07-30 8:03 AM
( End of Report )
